intro: Aspidostemon humbertianus, commonly known as the Humbert's aspidostemon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
